"Fox awaken my descendent," comes the calm and ethereal voice of a specter that hangs over the sleeping body of Fox. Looking closer at the specter it is indeed an almost exact copy of Fox, if a few years older. It was even wearing a jump suit of sorts, though the logo was different from Fox's StarFox logo. Fox, hearing the words of the spirit in his sleep simply rolls over, mumbling something about five more minutes

"Awaken," it says again, a little more firmly than before, this time Fox tells the voice to go away, waving at the door to his room in the Great Fox. The spirit, who had been blue in hue before, begins to vibrate in the air, and his color shifts to a blood crimson that seems to burn itself into everything it touches.

"I said get up, you lazy son of a bitch!" it screams, and this time Fox shouts in surprise, reaching for a weapon that isn't there, and leaping to his feet looking for his assailant.

"Who, what, when?" he asks in quick succession, his eyes darting around for the source of the voice, but instead finding that he is on some strange, alien landscape, with odd smooth, gray terrain reaching towards huge cliffs that looked smoother than the floor. The cliffs all went up into towering heights, before reaching some massive ceiling that was held aloft by their titanic strength. Looking around the only feature not smooth is a nearby mesa with soft looking, white sides, that rose above his head like a monolith.

"Fox, hear my words," came the voice again, and Fox now found the source to be the specter who had just been in his dreams. It looked so much like him, but it was just an outline of blue, with this one having just a hint of red that faded as he watched.

"Dad?" he asked, not sure if he wasn't seeing ghosts again, as he had just after beating Andross the first time.

"No, Fox, I am not James, my name is Feral, and though we share blood, ours is separated by two generations," said the ghost, and Fox just stared at it, not sure how to respond.

"I'm your great-grandfather, you nincompoop," said the specter again, and Fox nodded, finally understanding the thing's words.

"Right. So then great-grandfather Feral, where have you taken me?" asked Fox, who'd already decided to get information first, then panic afterward.

"I haven't taken you anywhere Fox, and just call me Feral," he said, and Fox nodded again.

"Ok, so if you haven't taken me anywhere, than where am I?" asked Fox, sure someone else had transported him somewhere, and Feral had somehow come to his aid.

"Why, you're still in your room Fox, just a wee bit on the small side," said Feral, and once more Fox nodded, as if he'd just been told the time of day, but then, looking around he did a double take on the ghost of his ancestor.

"I'm shrunk?!" he demanded of the ghost, looking in horror at the mesa, which he could now clearly see was his bed, and the bare walls were his bunk walls.

"Isn't that what I just said? Now open up those ears and listen to me. Someone named Razmak, an ancient sorcerer, is trying to conquer the Lylat system, for I think the third time. Because I stopped him last time he decided to cast a spell to take my descendents out of the picture before they could interfere, but thanks to a little ghostly power I kept him from outright killing you," he tells Fox, who stares at the spirit incredulously.

"And this is better?!" He asks rather harshly, and the spirit floats before him, a thoughtful expression on his face.

"Well, I admit this is an unexpected complication, but still, you're alive, and now all you have to do is stop Razmak from killing everyone. To do that I suggest you get that little blue chick to help you get big again, and then go after him with one of those fighters of your's He's hiding out on that planet where you beat the monkey man a few years back," said the spirit.

"Why can't you go get Krystal's attention?" asked Fox, realizing his small size was not something to play around with, as one of his teammates could easily see him and crush him like a bug, or worse eat him like one.

"Sorry, but you're on your own for that one. I can only appear to those who carry my blood, and you're the only one left. So go find some way to get the blue woman to make you big again, and then save us all my son," said the spirit with a note of finality before disappearing completely.

"Oh for the love of... And I just saved the universe. What's a guy got to do to get a week off around this Solar System?" complained Fox even as he walked to his door. Luckily it wasn't an automatic and he was able to crawl under it with ease. Unluckily he was faced with a choice right from the get go. One hallway led to the bridge, and the other to the kitchen. Either one was likely to be the death of him, but since he could only pick one he chose...

"Soon I'll be a Great Fox if I don't quit doing that," he commented to himself, striking his slightly rounder gut. He'd have to remember to do more training when he got big again, as he was already winded and he wasn't even halfway to the kitchen yet. Luckily it really wasn't all that far to the GreatFox's on board kitchen from his room, that being one of the reasons he'd picked that particular cabin his.

Panting and slightly out of breath, Fox rounded that last corner to the kitchen hallway. From somewhere deep within himself came a rumbling sound that reminded him he'd chosen this course both for the likelihood of finding someone, and for the certainty of being able to find something to snack on at the very least. Looking over at the door he saw his luck was improving, as the light in the kitchen was on, meaning someone was in it. Filling with a sense of hope he ran towards the light, and at last looked into the kitchen to find the massive form of...
1112212.title: An often walked path

choices: Run over to the giantess, screaming his head off
11122121.content:
"Well, isn't that a lovely sight," said Fox to himself, staring at the shape of Krystal silhouetted in the light from the fridge. She was beautiful as always, and from his angle Fox happened to be looking right up her skirt as she was leaned over, rummaging through the drawers at the bottom of the fridge for something. He couldn't tell what it was, but it didn't matter. Seeing as how she was in the room, food was going to take second base to getting attention.

Of course getting attention wasn't going to be that easy. He was mouse sized compared to the blue vixen, which meant he would have to do something loud or bright to get her to notice him. Feeling his belt he wished not for the first time that he'd taken Falco's suggestion and started sleeping with his gun holstered. If he had that he could just fire off a shot and she'd be bond to see it, and then trace it back to him.

Not having the blaster, or anyway to make a bright, attention grabbing flash, Fox was left with two choices. The first was to just run up to Krystal and start yelling. Though he wasn't sure she'd hear him from way up where her head was. The second option, while far harder, was much more likely to get him noticed, and that was to climb the nearby counter. Of course it would take time to do that, and Krystal could well leave before he got to the top. Which course does he take?
11122121.title: Can't beat the view

111221211.content:
"Krystal, down here!!!" shouted Fox as loud as he could, cupping his hands over his mouth like a megaphone. Of course, as he'd expected Krystal remained in her position, leaning in the fridge and searching for something. Closer to her now Fox could see she was searching in the meat drawer for something, probably not remembering that she'd shared the last of that with him just hours ago before he'd gone to bed.

"WELL, I CAN'T MAKE ONE WITHOUT SOMETHING," she said, her voice so loud it hurt Fox's ears, forcing him to cover them in pain. Rising Krystal turned back to the counter, staring at something on it with a look of concern on her face while shaking her head. Fox, his ears still ringing, wonder what she was making, but decided it was unimportant. He had to get her attention, and fast, before she decided to leave.

Two choices was becoming a regular number for him, as he was again struck with an idea. He could just stay where he was screaming and hope that Krystal looked down. That was seeming to be a smaller and smaller possibility. He could now also, he saw, climb into the drawer she was looking into via an overhanging thread. That was bound to get her to notice him, but he could get hurt in the process too. Looking back at the giantess he decided to...
111221211.title: Getting attention isn't easy

1112212112.content:
Not really considering all the implications of his next action Fox ran over to the open fridge door and grabbed the string hanging from the top. Quickly he tied one end around his waist and began to repel up the side of the open drawer which Krystal would hopefully look into to find him sitting there. Luckily for him the drawer was only about five times his current height, and he was able to scale it in only a few leaps, letting go of the rope during his arc so that he would fall right into it, and landing at the bottom with a dull thunk.

"Krystal!" he shouted again, already feeling the bitting cold of the fridge. Unfortunately Krystal was staring at the counter top, not really paying any attention to the drawer anymore. It suddenly occurred to Fox then that she might not look inside closely enough to see him before she closed the fridge, sealing him inside it. If he didn't suffocate from a lack of air, then he would freeze to death long before anyone else would look inside.

"Kr-kr-krystal!!" he cried out, a small stutter entering his speech already. Looking up he prayed for the goddess to notice him before shutting the door. As he watched her head swung back and forth again as she starred at whatever was on the counter, before turning one last time to the fridge, probably intending on closing it and going back to bed, but just before she did a flash caught her eye, and she looked straight down at the tiny Fox at the bottom of the drawer.

"Well hello there little one. I didn't notice you," she said, her voice sounding farther away to Fox within the closed confines of the drawer. It wasn't really that much quieter compared to her previous, but the echo effect of the box made it softer on his ears. Smiling at his turn of luck he ran towards Krystal's descending hand, letting her fingers pinch him at his waist. Their heat filtered into his body quickly, alleviating part of his chill as he stared up in gratitude at her.

"WELL, WELL, A BIT COLD ARE WE. DON'T WORRY, YOU'LL BE NICE AND WARM INSIDE MY BELLY," she told him in that booming voice as she held him in front of her mouth, and for a few moments Fox just nodded at her words, not really hearing that last part. Then all at once his mind latched onto it, and he took a deep breath to shout at Krystal about her mistake, but before he could do so she had placed him on the counter, atop a soft white table, that he instantly identified as a slice of bread.

He was still ready to shout at her, when suddenly a stream of semi-liquid goo was squirted onto him, causing him to hack and cough. Licking a bit off his covered arms he was quick to ID the goo as ketchup, and even quicker to ID the green carpet falling atop him as lettuce. Still coughing up ketchup Fox was then subjected to having the wind knocked from him as Krystal dropped the second slice of bread atop him, completing her snack.

"Oh boy," he said wheezingly, not remembering any swear words that were harsh enough to cover this particular situation. Looking out he realized his head was just outside the sandwich, and he spun around so that he was on his back, and looking straight up at Krystal, who, instead of looking at him as he would have expected, was playing with something that looked like a lance or long sword, but he knew was probably just a butter knife.

"I WONDER IF FOX WOULD LIKE A SNACK?" she mused to herself, and Fox wished he could laugh. Krystal was deciding if she wanted to cut her sandwich in half, and him too, so she could offer half of it to him. Of course he also realized that she might have included other small animals in previous snacks, which explained why they were so crunchy. He wished he had the saliva to start spiting out the remembered taste of those snacks now, as he hated the idea of biting something's head off. Above him Krystal was still spinning the knife in one hand, and then slowly brought it down to...
1112212112.title: Krystal makes a Fox Sandwich, Yum

choices: "Sorry Fox, but now that you know I must eat you!"

Fox screamed at the top of his lungs as the knife was brought down. He closed hios eyes tight and waited for the pain.

But it never came.

The knife just missed his foot paws, somehow. He looked up to her and gave one final shout.

"KKKKRRRRRYYYYYSSSSSTTTTTTAAAAALLLLLLLLLLLLL!!!!!"

11122121121.title: A near miss.

choices: Krystal decides to give Fox some memories to cherishes on his way down her throa
111221211212.content:
Krystal stopped, looking shocked down at her comrade wedged between the two slices of bread.

"Fox, is that really you," she asked, stunned, as she stared aghast at his minute size. She peeled the top slice off of him and helped him stand up, placing him on the counter.

"Yes, it is. I was hoping you could help me. I actually thought you were going to eat me there for a second." Fox laughed silently at his comment, strutting to get his blood moving around the placid counter-top.

"Actually, I was hoping to keep this a secret," sighed Krystal, placing her hand over her mouth as she spoke.

"What," asked Fox, slightly perplexed.
"I have an obsession.... with eating living things."

Fox froze at her statement, unsure of what to say.
"Well, we all have quirks," he tried to sooth her, seeing she was clearly uncomfortable.

"It was actually a part of our culture back on Cerinia, every once in a while."

Fox gagged at the fact, swallowing hard, looking around the metal clad kitchen. He caught a smirk on Krystal's face, and her tail swinging playfully.

"That's all behind us now," he breathed weakly. "Now if you don't mind, could you help me return to my normal size?"

Krystal looked at him hungrily.
"Maybe get out of this kitchen?"

There was a long silence, Krystal watched him, eyes unwavering. Her tongue ran over her teeth in her mouth, saliva dripping, filling like a pool along her gums.

"I can't do that, Fox," she said sternly, still watching him.

"Why not?" Fox felt fear rising in his chest, and he drooped his tail, tensing his body, ready to bolt if he had to.

"I have actually dreamed of eating you," she squeaked, cringing as she said it, clearly embarrassed, looking away for only a short second.

Fox froze, unsure of what to say. He fidgeted, stepping back from her monstrous figure. As he did he couldn't help sneaking a peak at her massive chest, chuckling coyly. His mind then echoed what she had said, and he again became cautious, unnerved with a surprised awe.

"That's fine, Krystal, I don't really care. But could you help me?"

Krystal again said nothing. "Can you at least take me back to my room," he asked.

Quick as the wind a furry blue hand struck from Krystal's hip, rocketing toward Fox and embracing him in a tight grip between five pulsing fingers!

"Krystal what are you doing!" Fox screamed as the arm attached to the figures brought Fox's squirming body toward Krystal's, the vixen smiling down at him as saliva poured over her lips.

"I have dreamed of eating you, Fox, and now that dream will become a reality," she grinned, and laughed as Fox struggled.

"Krystal, you can't do this to me! I saved you! I brought you here!"

Krystal remained silent, mulling over her fantasies in the enigma of her mind! Her hand began moving up her body, slowly, toward her mouth! As Fox passed her stomach he could hear it growl under the fabric of her clothes! Krystal moaned, and rubbed her belly with her free hand.

"I'm so hungry, Fox, I hope you can fill me up!" She laughed, still rubbing her stomach, and licked her lips. "I'll bet you'll taste delicious, too. All those battles must have worked some taste into you!"

Fox watched, horrified, as he was hoisted up, quickly passing Krystal's chest, neck, and face. He stared pleadingly into her turquoise-green eyes, and said one last time:

"Krystal, please, don't eat me! I'll do anything! Please!"

Krystal ignored him, bringing him higher into the air! She tilted her head back, twirling her locks, and opened her mouth, sloshing her tongue in the saliva and swallowing a bit of it. Dangling Fox over her maw, she stopped, allowing him to get a good look at his impending doom. She still felt him struggling, and almost instantly thought that maybe she should do something else first. Weighing her choices, she held Fox there as he screamed.

"Krystal, don't eat me! Please don't eat me!" repeated Fox over and over again.

"Fox," she started, her voice blasting out from her mouth louder than ever to Fox's anxious, honed ears!

She opened her mouth again...
111221211212.title: Krystal's Unhappy Meal

Krystal felt a strange feeling, like a weight was lifted off her shoulders. The doubt that was keeping her from eating Fox was gone, and replaced with certainty, trust, and a little lust.
"I can do it Fox." Krystal said as she lifted fox over her mouth.

"Good luck Fox." Krystal said to Fox, realizing what she was about to do.

Krystal released Fox allowing gravity to pull Fox towards Krystal's awaiting mouth. Everything seemed to slow down for Fox, he was about to get eaten by the girl he's had a crush on for weeks, he might become normal size again, and this might not work and he would probably die from this.

Fox landed on Krystal's tounge, he felt the warm, soft, fleshy surface beneath him, and the razor sharp teeth all around him. Krystal was overtaken by the taste of Fox, "oh my god this is incrediable." she thought.

11122121122111.title: first Krystal Pred Chapter in A While

111221211221112.content:
Hours passed as Fox's unconcious body was absorbed by Krystal's digestive system. But sadly, it hadn't worked. Krystal's anchient ritual hadn't helped Fox... it had killed him. But Krystal didn't know this yet, she would have to wait until the morning to find this out. "I hope it works." Krystal thought to her self as she fell asleep. With Fox Mcloud digesting inside her she fell asleep easier than usual, and didn't wake up to get another late-night snack like an other night. This was highly unusual.


Krystal awoke the next morning, and with curisoity, hope, and fear rushed to Fox's room.
Her heart sank when she saw the empty bed. She fell to her knees."uuhhgg... no." She thought as she began to cry. Realizing that she had killed Fox Mcloud.
Just then her communicator beeped. She read the text. it read: "Krystal what have you done? You've created a time paradox. The future has changed." Krystal didn't know what it ment and she didn't care. All that mattered was greifig over Fox's death. Everyone would soon find out.

Months pass and the Lylat system is compleatly overrun with enemy forces. Corneria was all but taken. The Star Fox team was under constant attack by the enemy. An attempt to destroy the enemy's main base on Venom had failed miseriably resulting in the death's of 400 cornerian soldiers... and 3 Star Fox team members. Krystal was the only one left. The enemy had boarded the ship, ready to kill her as well. Her last thought was. "Fox... I'm sorry."

1121.content:
Falco awoke to another boring day on the Great Fox. Breakfast went by as usual with Peppy nearly drowning in his coffee, Krystal unsuccessfuly flirting with Fox, and Slippy annoying the hell out of Falco.

After breakfast, Falco remained at the table with his head in his hand. The other drummed the table while he yawned loudly, watching ROB clean up the messy dishes without any acknowledgment to the bird sitting behind him. His eyes darted around the table and he spotted the newspaper sticking out from under one of Slippy's inventions.

He grabbed it and started reading through it. More boring stuff, he thought as he skimmed through the buisness and polictal articles. He contemplated leaving the team due to boredom again, but he was told that if he tried to leave again, they'd tie him to his chair. He sighed and turned to the entertainement section.

He started reading and thought about activities he could take part in during the day. There were advertisements for movies, video games, and the biggest attraction of all, the Corneria City Zoo. He yawned again and decided what he was going to do.

Falco decided to stay on the Great Fox. There wasn't much to do there, but being with friends would possibly offer some kind of opportunity for some fun. The bird put down the newspaper and began to head for the recreation room.

Along the way, he stopped to use the bathroom. On his way back down, he took a brief stop to his room to get dressed. The bird exited his room and made his way over to recreation room.

Tired, Falco yawned and crashed on the couch, flipping the TV on. Falco flipped through the channels before settling on some cartoons. They were always better than boring news reports. As he sat there and watched memories of his childhood, someone sat next to him. Falco looked up and spotted...

Falco decided he'd go down to Corneria to have some fun, maybe go to the zoo or a movie. He got up and told ROB to prepare his Arwing while he headed to the bridge to let Fox know where he was going.

After all that was said and done, Falco retreated to his bedroom and changed into his clothes, the blood red armoured suit he wore during the Aparoid invasion. After looking at himself in the mirror, he decided to change into some normal clothes for fear of being the center of attention of a large mob. Just wearing a plain T-shirt, blue jeans, and his old white StarFox jacket, Falco decided it was time to go.

He ran down the seemingly endless hallway to the hangar and jumped into his Arwing. He fired up the engines and checked the fuel cell count. He had enough to fly to Corneria and back five times, which was plenty of fuel for his short trip to the planet. ROB disengaged the lock and launched the ship out into space.

Falco flew recklessly through space, opening up his Comlink to confirm is identification with the Cornerian Space Defense station orbiting the planet. From there, he flew straight so that he wouldn't be the cause of an accident in the space or planet traffic. His GPS indicated that his ETA to the small vehicle dock was less than a minute. Falco picked up the speed with one press of his boost button and brought the ship to a soft landing in Dock 3B.

112121.content:
Falco decided he'd go visit the zoo in the middle of Corneria City's central park. It was a large park in the middle of Corneria, one of the only places in the city where you could get away from modern day life. Falco sighed as the buildings flew past his view, staring out the window while tapping his knee with a feathered paw. He took a glance over to the driver, who kept staring at Falco as if he recongized the bird, but couldn't figure out from where.

The bored avian returned his gaze to outside the window, tapping out a tune on his leg. The driver finally spoke up and smiled as he talked. "Hey, you're Falco Lombardi, ain't ya?" He said, glancing back but keeping his eyes on the hovercar track.

Falco sighed again and nodded. "Yes. I am." He said softly, beginning to lose hope that he wouldn't be mobbed by a large group of fans.

The driver chuckled and Falco raised an eyebrow as the driver turned off the fare meter. "Lylation heroes shouldn't have to pay me. In fact, it should be me that pays you!" The driver said with a laugh.

Falco smirked a bit and winked back at the driver. "You already did. You gave me back my money."

The driver grinned and took the exit off the hovertrail that led to the main parking lot of the zoo. Two roads appeared and the driver took the left and before long, the car slowly landed on the ground in the parking lot. Falco said his thanks and climbed out of the car. As he walked to the ticket booth, the feline inside recognized him immediately and waved him through without charging him, slipping a V.I.P. wristband through the ticket window for Falco to take. The avian sighed and slipped it on, then stopped in front of the map. The zoo was divived into differnt sections for each animal type on two sides of the park. Each section was accessible by a V shaped fork path. On the left path were areas such as the reptile display, avian display, aquarium, and oddities. On the right path were displays for mammals, dinosaurs, and the bathrooms. Both sections were linked by a straight path that led from the reptile display to the mammal display.

Falco sighed, having taken the left path many times with Fox, who was obessed with the snakes the zoo had on display. He looked down the right path, then down the left. He decided to...

"Hmmm..." thought Krystal, head swimming with possibilities, "crime is easily punished in this region. I'll have to somehow cover up the evidence."

She smirked as she realized once again what it was she was plotting, but her stomach growled again and the smirk left her face.
"I guess I'll..."
113112.title: More thinking

1131122.content:
Krystal began to concentrate again and focused her thoughts on the layout of the Great Fox's schematics and its security systems. Because her telepathic ability relied on electrical signals, she was able to affect everything in the ship, though of course she had never told anyone about that, thinking that she would surprise everyone by fixing a failing system at the last moment, thereby acting as a sort of "Deus Ex Machina," should the need arise. It would make for some great drama and legitimize her as a member of the team, rather than just some follower who needed to be saved. Of course, now she was using that power as the team's destruction rather than its saving grace. "It's amazing what a base drive such as hunger will do to a person's motives," she thought, "I guess our will isn't as free as we'd like to think it is."
When the entire ship was inside her head, she grimaced and subtly knocked out all communication signals, disabling ROB 64 as well.
With that done, she went out to investigate Fox's scent, which was much closer now. She opened up her door because the rest of the powered items in the Great Fox were still working. She looked around and saw Fox heading toward his room down the hall. She called to him and he turned around.
1131122.title: No communication for you!

11311221.content:
"What is it, Krystal?" Fox asked, approaching her.
"I was just wondering how you were doing," she replied, walking toward him with that walk she's so fond of, "you seem to be a bit down lately." She was telling the truth; he had seemed a bit put-off by something lately.
"Heh. Well, ah...I guess I can tell you," he said, still approaching her. "I've been thinking about my dad a lot lately. I keep getting dreams about him and I feel like I'm going to meet him soon. I know he's dead and everything, but it just seems that way to me."
This took Krystal off-guard and her head spun for a fraction of a second. Could Fox have latent psychic abilities? This would put a wrench in her plan if he called out at the last second for help using his mind. Just then, her stomach growled and she feigned embarrasment. She said, "Oh, I see. That explains it, then." She reached out and grabbed his shoulders in sympathy, "Thanks for telling me about this, Fox. I'm glad you trust me."
Then, without warning, she shoved his long muzzle into hers, storing it in her right cheek. "Just keep trusting me, Fox. It's okay," she projected to him as he tensed up and began to struggle.
11311221.title: Confession

113112211.content:
Apparently Krystal's entreaty to calm down and trust her hadn't worked. Fox was still trying to get his muzzle out of her cheek with all his might as he began letting out muffled yells that he just couldn't project because her teeth kept his jaw closed. It made sense, of course. She doubted anyone really WANTED to be eaten alive, and mouths are pretty disgusting things to look at, let alone be in. She decided to have some sympathy for the struggling friend. "Look, I can project nice images into your mind while I do this, if you want me to. It'll take away the shock a bit," she thought to him.
Hearing this, he calmed down a little bit, but only because he realized she wasn't entirely evil and meant to make this as comfortable as possible for him, considering what she was doing. He thought, knowing that she would be able to read it, "No, that's okay. If I have to go, I'd rather you do it and leave my mind out of it. I still like you and would rather you don't do this, but you seem to have some reason other than sheer madness. I just wish I knew what that reason was."
She opened wider and began stuffing the rest of his head into her cheek, licking the outside of his cheek consolingly, as if she were licking his wounds. "I have to. My power requires I eat someone around my body size every once in a while, or I'll die of energy loss. I've been eating a fallen foe here and there when we were on our adventures, but this peaceful universe doesn't allow that anymore, and I've been holding out so long that if I wait an hour longer I'll die. I figured you'd be the most understanding person on this crew," she told him and opened a little wider, stuffing his neck and shoulders in her cheek in the process, causing a comical, cartoonish bulge. What she said was pretty much true, but she was sure she could have avoided it if she really wanted to. Thing is...she didn't want to. Fox tasted just as good as she thought he would. She lifted him off the ground and shoved him into her cheek just beneath his shoulder blades, effectively pinning his arms between the strong muscles in her mouth. Anyone looking at this would laugh first before being horrified at what was going on. She pulled some more in, engulfing him up to the end of his ribcage, cheek sticking farther out and then with the obvious outline of Fox McCloud's head. He struggled a little more, but not much.
113112211.title: Whoa...those cheeks are flexible.

1131122111.content:
Krystal focused a bit before she made her next move. She wanted to make sure no one was coming near enough to see or hear what was going on. Luckily, no one was around, so she grabbed Fox by the belt and hoisted him up to his pantline in her mouth, her cheek well beyond what a cheek of that size would normally be able to contain. She bit into him a little bit on accident, making him wince in pain, then retracted quickly and apologized. She'd have to concentrate on not trying to chew him up. It just wouldn't be nice to he who saved her life earlier and it wouldn't be as pleasurable for her when she finally swallowed him. Her hand moved behind his knees and lifted them up into her other cheek. She shoved his legs in up to his boots, which remained outside her lipline.
His tail wagged back and forth, but mostly in annoyance rather than happiness. He wanted her to get it over with, and she was just taking too long. It kinda' made him mad that she was taking so much pleasure in it, but he couldn't begrudge her that. After all, he'd looked at her in ways he probably shouldn't have and gotten caught a few times. It was about time she enjoyed something at his expense...although this seemed too much. Getting eaten alive didn't seem a just payback. "Oh well..." he thought. Not much he could do now.
The vixen shoved Fox's boots into her cheek along with his legs, leaving his rump and his tail outside her mouth. Having an entire creature her size in just her cheeks put considerable strain on her neck, so she sucked in his rear-end, leaving only a flicking tail. She licked around and smiled a bit before she gave a gigantic gulp, forcing that bulge in her cheeks to transfer to her neck and onward down her esophagus, dragging the tail through her lips after it. The tail disappeared with a satisfying slurp and a small amount of saliva left her mouth. The bulge went down her ribcage and then rested itself safely in her midsection with a plop and a gurgle. She let out a little sigh and licked her lips, eyes closed, and rubbing her now-extended stomach. "Well, it was nice knowing you," she thought to herself, making sure she guarded her thoughts from Fox. With that, she put a glamer upon herself to make it look like she had her normal body composition.
Fox moved around in her gut, but couldn't make himself comfortable. He just sighed and let the walls carress him firmly, albeit with a large amount of moist slime. He just couldn't keep himself mad at Krystal, no matter how hard he tried. Yes, she just ate him, but she was so pretty. That's got to count for something. "They say looks don't matter, but they're liars," he thought, and closed his eyes. A grin was on his face.
1131122111.title: Fox: Down the hatch.

Actually, now that she's thinking about these things and trying on her new outfit for the next game that's coming out, she isn't sure why she's here. It seemed as if fate or some greater entity forced her to love this guy who could easily defeat the entire Cornerian fleet in its prime. She began to entertain thoughts that the only reason she existed was as a love interest for Fox as someone knocked on her door...

Fox grabs the leaning vixen by her the collar of her new white outfit. Despite her confusion and her pulling away, he opens up his maw and shoves her muzzle in.
Krystal can't believe what's happening. She thinks it's a joke at first, until she can no longer see around his open mouth and all that her vision encompasses are his rows of teeth, his tongue, the roof of his mouth, and his ever-nearing throat.
Fox likes the feel of Krystal's chin on his tongue and her forehead on the roof of his mouth. He starts wagging his tail as Krystal's nose enters his throat, which widens to accomodate its larger-than-usual guest.
Krystal's eyes widen as she is somehow forced through what she thought was a small opening. She's completely stunned and starts to think it's a dream. Mr. McCloud, easily the most and only competent soldier in the galaxy, now has this blue vixen in his gullet up to her belly. She laughs and smiles, then remembers her situation and is stricken with fear and tenses up. Now that I've thought that, I'm probably doomed to keep thinking about it," she thinks, then smiles because she was thinking about thinking rather than about her situation. She laughs again. Fox is now sliding Krystal's thighs into his throat. He swallows again, and she's up to her knees. All that's left are her calves and boots. She had decided long ago not to use her telepathic powers to read his mind, but she just has to know why he did it. She concentrates hard, then her eyes pop open and she laughs heartily, making Fox laugh as well. She feels him pat where her head is, probably in affection. She says to herself, smiling with irony, "So THAT'S why. Fox, you little bastard..."

Fox walks back onto the bridge amidst much cheering and hollering. He rubs the back of his head, blushing, and gives a loud belch. "Well, that's that," he says, and tosses the boot on the floor, "pay up: 20 bucks each."
Falco, Slippy, Peppy, ROB 64, General Pepper, Panther, and Leon each give him $20. They're still beaming. Slippy says, "I didn't think you had it in ya', Fox," and Falco chimes in, "Yeah, but now he has HER in him!" and laughs.
Peppy says, "Well done, Fox. You're becoming more like your...well, actually James never did anything like this. He wasn't really into cannibalism..." and he chuckles his old man chuckle.
Wolf looks at Fox for a while and the room goes silent. He says, "Well done. You're more impressive than I thought. I guess I'll hold up my end of the bargain and take out Tricky. You want I should blast him with an Arwing, a Landmaster, or something else?"
Fox rubs his tummy, eyes closed in pleasure, and says, "I don't care. Right now, I have a really nice vixen in my stomach and a crew that just gave me $140 for a bet that I won. Do what you want, man," and he leaves the room to talk with Krystal as she lingers in his gut. He's glad he succumbed to this peer pressure.

Fox's eyes suddenly opened wide, the scene being replaced by a ceiling. He looked around confused, then down at his stomach. It was completely the same as it had always been. He looked to his side and saw Krystal sleeping next to him. "It was all a dream..." He said quietly, looking around.

He sat up in bed and rubbed his paws over his face. What a dream it was, but he didn't understand it. It was the first dream he had like that. His other dreams involved himself getting eaten, mostly by monsters, but as he grew up, those monsters began to turn into people he knew. Krystal groaned softly as she turned around and opened her eyes. "Fox? What's wrong?" She asked, rubbing her eyes.

Krystal gasped, wide awake now. "Really? Wow! I had a dream just like that, only I ate you and it was a bet with the rest of the team and StarWolf!" She said, giggling, the two having the same, but opposite dream.

"May I help you?" a kind-looking vulpinoid secretary asked the spokesperson for this fairly large group of people. She figured it was either fairly important or these people came to intimidate her. They looked friendly enough, though, other than the reptile and the lupinoid.
"Yes," said the equally-kind-looking vulpinoid who seemed to be the spokesman of the group, "we're here to see Miss Weltzin. I have the understanding that she has an open-door policy, correct?"
"That is correct," responded the secretary, "However, I must warn you. She's not in the best of moods this time of month, if you know what I mean..."
"Ah, I see," said the handsome vulpinoid male who looked strangely familiar now that the secretary thought about it, "Well, this is fairly important (confirming her first suspicion). May we enter anyway?"
Shocked, the secretary waved them in without a word. She couldn't believe something urgent would have to come to Miss Weltzin. Perhaps her boss was more important than she thought. This shock is what made her forget that once or twice the people who came to see Samantha didn't come out...

The group shuffled in: the vibrant fox leader, followed by a blue-furred vixen, followed by a blue-feathered bird, followed by a squat toad, followed by the sneering and pissy-looking wolf (she'll have to remember to avoid that one's glance), followed by a decent-looking black felinoid male, followed at last by the hooded, creepy-looking lizard-man (whose gaze she also avoided). They went in and the lizard closed the door behind him. For a second, she feared for Miss Weltzin's safety and was about to call security just in case, but then she remembered that the benevolent ones outnumbered the malevolents. Besides, she knew Miss Weltzin could take care of herself.
15421111.title: Through a secretary's eyes.

154211111.content:
Samantha Weltzin was working on some documents diligently when the large group came in. Her office was not terribly large, so it made the place somewhat stuffy. Nevertheless, she tried to keep a pleasant demeanor and welcomed them in with a weary half-smile. She had been working all night, compounded with the fact that she had just menstruated about an hour and a half ago, so she had to work hard to put on a decent face.
"Yes?" she asked.
"Hi," said the handsome vulpinoid, blushing because he hadn't expected Miss Weltzin to be so...attractive. "Uh, we've heard about your ability with magic and we were wondering if...uh...you'd like to help us out with a problem we've been having lately."
The vulpinoid looked over to the vixen and smiled, then turned his head quickly away to hide his sudden and immense blush. Samantha deduced that he was ashamed to be more smitten with her than with this other person who must be his mate. The frown on the vixen's face confirmed it. No matter, though; she was going to keep this business strictly professional and be done with them so she wouldn't end up ruining a relationship (though she kinda' liked the fox at first sight, too, she dismissed it as simple infatuation that would leave once her memory of him faded in a day or two).
"Well, tell me the problem and I'll see if I can help you with it," she said after a pause, feeling slightly annoyed at the uncomfortable atmosphere and the large amount of males of different species staring at her.
The fox jumped, startled at her sudden comment: "Well, it looks like a new threat to the Lylat System's coming on. We were wondering if you'd assist us in the development of magically-augmented weapons." He quickly added, "You'll be well-paid, of course. Ever since we saved Sauria, we've been rolling in the funds."
Then the identity of this group snapped into Samantha's mind and her face clearly showed she had just suddenly come to a realization. "You're StarFox?" she asked.
The gruff wolf in the back barked, "And StarWolf! Don't you forget it!"
The person she now recognized as Fox McCloud rubbed the back of his head and said, "Yeah. I thought you'd know us on sight. Maybe we're not so famous in this corner of the galaxy. That's okay, though. Celebrity isn't all that great."
"Well, if you're StarFox (And StarWolf, of course...), then what right do I have to refuse?" she said, anger clearly in her voice at her diplomatic helplessness. She thought, "Ah, shit...I feel it coming on...I'd better get them out of here quickly or the galaxy is doomed..."
"Oh, come off it. We came here anonymously. It was you who figured out who we were and thought that meant something," the vixen whose name must be Krystal said, a vein clearly visible at her jealous temple.
"Now, now, Krystal. We're asking her a favor, why be rude about it?" Fox said, putting his hands on her shoulders and trying to calm her down.
She pushed his hands off and crossed her arms, still angry.
Meanwhile, the others were looking around the room nervously. The toad, Slippy, she remembered, piped up, "Aw, don't mind her. She gets like that when Fox is nice to people more beautiful than her," to which Krystal promptly jumped at him, knocked him on the floor, and, kneeling upon his belly, started strangling him. Falco, Wolf, Panther, and Leon quickly moved in front of the scene to block it from their potential ally's view.
"Yeah. I'll do it. I'll be there in a few days. Now get out of here before your amphibious friend is choked to death," she said, waving her hand toward the door.
Fox stepped toward her desk ("Please don't do that," she thought) and said, "Uh...actually, we need you to come with us right now. We need you as soon as possible. It's pretty grim, from what the forecast seems to show. Hundreds of thousands of ships. We need something magical to be able to take out multip..." Samantha stopped him with her hand and said, "Seriously, please leave. I'll explain later, but right now I need some privacy..."
"What's wrong? Maybe we can help..." he began to say and Krystal stopped choking Slippy, turned her head, eyes flashing fire as she got up and began to walk toward Fox.
"You heard the 'beautiful' woman, Fox. She needs her 'alone-time," she said with as much sarcasm as she could muster. Samantha's anger flared and she decided that if she snapped and went on her eating spree (which she was intolerably close to), she would start with the bitch she had so honorably tried to save from some grief earlier...

The others, meanwhile, stared at the spectacle of their teammate (and only estrogen onboard the Great Fox) being shrunk to a diminutive size. They barely noticed that she was about to be eaten.
Samantha, in the meantime, lifted Krystal just over her mouth, licked the little vixen, and let her slide down her tongue. When Krystal was sufficiently inside her mouth, she slurped her tongue back in and enveloped the struggling woman. She snapped her muzzle shut, spraying a small amount of spittle onto her desk.
Krystal was horrified to be in the position she was in. It was the last thing she expected Miss Weltzin to do. She wiggled and scratched, kicked and clawed, but nothing she could do would stop the inevitable gulp. She felt herself being tossed to one side of the mouth, where she felt hard, pointed enamel come down onto her back. It wasn't so hard that it pierced her flesh, but it did leave a nasty bruise. She yelped and started to cry. She didn't want to go yet. Fox was still playing coy with her and she was just getting good with guns and vehicles, though her martial arts needed a little work.
As she thought this, she felt another bite and cried out. The tongue swished back toward her and removed her from that painful vice. However, she had no time to rejoice when she felt it give a thrust, sending her to its back, which quickly smacked her against the back wall of the throat, sending her to a tube where muscular action roiled and pulled her downward. She heard a sickening *Ulp...* and realized that she had just been swallowed whole. She screamed.
15421111111.title: Krystal is kitty kibble.

choices: Next up...or down, depending on how you look at it.
154211111112.content:
Licking her lips and enjoying the struggling creature in her belly, Samantha stood up from her chair and began to move around her desk toward the group.
Falco was the first to snap out of the stupor. He said, "Hey! Didn't she just eat Krystal? Why aren't we doing something about this?!" He reached for his blaster, forgetting that it had been confiscated at the entrance of the building. He looked up just in time to realize Miss Weltzin was casting one heck of a spell. She seemed to be concentrating incredibly hard and her nose had started to bleed a little. Wolf began to run toward her to subdue her, but she got the spell off and everyone but Fox became as small as Krystal. Wolf was still running but stopped once he realized he wasn't making nearly as much headway as a couple seconds before and that he was running toward a large foot. He started to turn back when he was suddenly grasped and lifted high into the air. "You can't do this to me!" he yelled, but apparently his captor disagreed because he soon found himself shoved into her maw. He grabbed onto her tongue with his arms and legs firmly wrapped around it, but it was quite slippery, so he knew he'd have to do something quickly. Just what, however, he wasn't sure. He wrestled with the large muscle in the moist darkness for about four seconds and then was thrown forcefully back, knocking him out cold. He didn't even feel himself being escorted down her esophagus and landing on Krystal's back, which knocked her over with an "Oof!"
154211111112.title: She shrinks all but Fox, and gulps down Wolf.

choices: Fox can't help you now. Sorry, Falco.
1542111111121.content:
Slippy and Panther rushed toward the door, but were horrified to find that they were too large to fit under the crack but far too small to turn the doorknob. They started pounding frantically on the door, but it didn't make much noise at all. The secretary would have noticed their yells for help, however, if she wasn't listening to music through her headphones and playing Internet games.
Leon rushed toward the bottom of the desk and attempted to use his uncanny hiding ability to cloak himself under it. He didn't know that Samantha saw him go under there, however, so he remained still and silent in hopes that she would give up after she had eaten all those other fools.
Falco banked his chances on Fox. He looked up at him and nodded at him, Fox nodding back. Falco then began to run circles around Samantha's feet, hoping to distract her long enough to allow Fox to control her and stop her from casting any more spells or eating anyone else. Fox, having known Falco for a long time, could intuitively guess the bird's plan and started marching toward the rampaging felinoid.
He then realized he couldn't move. He was paralyzed. She had cast "Hold Person" on him and he was stuck in place.
Falco kept running around, not realizing that his ally was unable to complete his tactic. He changed running direction, stopping on a dime, to throw the (to him) colossal cat-woman off. However, this allowed the stomp that would have missed him to directly connect. She held him firmly under her foot as she bent down to grab him. When the foot loosened up a little, he tried to pull himself out. However, her hand was already waiting for him and snatched him up.
"Aw, man...just my luck. Why'd you have to become incompetent now, Fox? I thought you knew what I was planning...Fox?" He looked over at his ally from the large hand he was clasped in and noticed a dull stare from his teammate's pupils. "Crap! She got you, too?!" he said as he was jerked toward Miss Weltzin's face.
"Now this makes more sense. Cats are supposed to eat birds, not foxes and wolves," Samantha said. When she finished speaking, she let her tongue loll out and stuffed Falco into her mouth. She slurped her tongue back in and closed her jaws, trapping him with nowhere to go but down. She swished him around a little bit, enjoying his flavor more than the preceding victims. After a little while, she decided that was enough and swallowed hard, making an audible *Glurp!* A small lump could be seen going past her scarf and disappearing around her collarbone. About a half a second later, a muffled, "Not you, too!" could be heard from inside the purring felinoid.
1542111111121.title: Falco's turn on the waterslide.

choices: The last two are eaten...but what of Fox?
15421111111211.content:
Leon saw from under the desk the two remaining miniaturized fools cowering in each others' arms at the door. He never did like the new recruit, Panther, because he seemed fairly weak and certainly wasn't as good a pilot as himself or Wolf...who was now in that damnable woman's belly. When he got out of here and the spell wore off, he would certainly take revenge on this person for so callously eating his leader. However, he supposed HE was now the leader, so in a way he had her to thank. He decided that he would make the assassination quick and devour the corpse afterward. It would be a fitting end.
The felinoid's feet began going toward the desk and Leon's heart jumped up into his throat. "How could she have seen me?!" he thought to himself. The feet turned away when they reached the desk, however, and he could hear it move above him a little. A small belch came from above, and he figured she was leaning on the desk, surveying her next two morsels.
Just then, Panther yelled, "Leon, watch out!" and Samantha turned around and dropped down quickly onto her knees and swiped her arm under the desk, grasping the lizard in one quick swoop and transferring him to that trap that had claimed three of his allies already. She stuffed him in her cheek and licked him with a large amount of slobber. This tickled him and he giggled his little lizard-giggle in spite of himself as he tried to ward off the tongue instinctively. He felt himself blushing and realized he liked it.
Slippy and Panther first looked at the crouching cat's nice little butt connected to the fluffy tail wagging in the air, then to each other, and smiled, knowing what the other was thinking.
They ran forward, arms outstretched, determined to embarrass the cat before they, too, joined their friends. Panther would take the left cheek and Slippy would take the right...they heard a familiar gulping sound.
15421111111211.title: The assassin's true colors.

choices: Samantha goes with Fox to stop the threat.
He's so helpless...maybe she should eat him after all...
154211111112111.content:
Slippy and Panther ran as fast as their legs could carry them.
After Samantha had swallowed Leon, she began to lift herself up with her arms.
The two tucked their heads down, trying to increase their aerodynamic ability as they rushed forward.
Samantha's head snapped toward them, a hungry look in her eyes, which quickly changed to a confused look.
They reached the end of their paths and each forcefully thrust their two hands onto firm denim covering soft, furry flesh. They let out cries of exhaltation at their minor success. They could even see her blush a little as she reached for them. Mission accomplished as she snatched them up in her hands and shoved them both in her mouth, making her cheeks bulge with the little people. They high-fived each other from across the rows of teeth and the tongue.
Samantha, in the meantime, was trying to control her blush. The radiating pink skin was clearly visible at the lower corners of her eyes as she nervously dragged the two to the back of her throat. She gave a quick, unthinking swallow and felt the two slide painfully down her throat. Her eyes watered as they got stuck once, but a sip of water from a canteen on her desk flushed them the rest of the way down. She coughed a little, then burped as the two displaced some of the air out of her stomach.
Krystal had already moved out of the way when she heard the last gulp, and moved Wolf out of the way, too. She held him close to her chest and looked what she figured was "up" to see if she could detect movement from that hole she and so many others had come through. Of course, it was pitch black and she was surprised when she heard a double splash near her feet. From what she could tell, Leon was enjoying himself because he kept making little happy noises on the other side of the chamber. She felt Wolf begin to stir in her arms and let go of him. He groaned, "Mmm...where...Ah, damn!" He pounded his fist into the wall in anger and stood up from Krystal's lap. He quickly fell back down because of the unsturdy, muscled floor that kept moving beneath his feet.
Slippy and Panther were still giggling like schoolgirls.
Falco was kicking the stomach wall repeatedly until it shot out a bit of acid onto him because of the stimulation. He decided that perhaps that was not the best idea and sat down, muttering curses to himself.
"Well, that's that, I guess," he said after a little while, "I get the feeling ol' Foxie-boy won't be joining us in this little picnic we're having. It seems like she left him unshrunk on purpose."
Slippy said, "Ohhh...don't mention picnics. Picnics mean food, and I'm hungry right now."
A few of the people chuckled, and Krystal said, with a smile (unseen by anyone of course), "I didn't realize food could be hungry." Everybody, including the usually-scornful Wolf O'Donnell, laughed as the stomach began to fill with the weak acid that aids Samantha Weltzin's digestion.
Samantha rubbed her belly a little and looked at the still-paralyzed Fox. She wasn't sure what to do with Fox. Her PMS-insanity was beginning to abate, but she was still tempted to devour him. Perhaps even in his current size...
154211111112111.title: Big, happy, digesting family.

1542111111121111.content:
Full and satisfied, Samantha smiled and released Fox from his affliction. Fox dropped to the floor on his knees and began to weep. Samantha walked over to him, kneeled down in front of him, lifted his chin with her finger and said, "There, there. I'm sorry about your friends. I tried to warn you. Normally, I'm a very nice person and I regret what I just did, but what's done is done. Let's go to your ship and save the universe." With that, Fox looked into her eyes and leapt forward into her arms, hugging her and crying over her shoulder. She patted him consolingly (stifled a belch, for his sake) until he had wept all his tears.
Just then, Fox's comlink began to ring. He took it out and the screen flashed up with Peppy Hare's face. "Hey, Fox! It turns out there is no galactic scourge. The monitor was just magnified too much. All those things we thought were ships...they were dust particles. Ha HA! Anyway, we won't require Miss Weltzin's assistance any more. Peppy over-and-out!" With that, the image disappeared back into the comlink. Fox and Samantha looked at each other and began to laugh heartily.
"Just a second while I throw up your friends. I really hate vomiting, but, like I said, I'm normally a nice person," Samantha said.
With that, she stood up, walked to the bathroom, opened the door, walked in, and shut the door. Fox got the feeling he'd be seeing more of this eccentric young woman, but certainly not after his friends got out of the infirmary. There's no way they'd allow him to so much as set foot on her planet again, let alone go to her office.
He sighed a deep sigh and began to chuckle as the doorway opened and Samantha and his (fully-grown) friends walked back in. They had a few scars, were completely drenched, and their clothes were tattered and pretty much worthless, but otherwise they were alright.
"Well, Mr. McCloud...gentlemen...lady...our business is concluded. If you wish for me to show you to the door..."
"NO!" Krystal, Panther, Slippy, Wolf, and Falco all said in unison (Leon said, "Sure."). They marched out of the room angrily (Leon following behind in a dreamlike state), and Samantha turned to Fox. "Well," Fox said, "I don't suppose I'll see you again any time soon..."
"I don't suppose so," said Samantha, wiping a small amount of vomit off her lip.
Krystal stormed into the room again, grabbed Fox's arm, and dragged him away in a huff, Fox waving goodbye.
Krystal slammed the door shut.
1542111111121111.title: Well, heck.

choices: Crush those little appetizers and ruin her figure!
1542111111121112.content: Aw...you just wanted to doom the universe, didn't you? Alright. How does she eat him?
1542111111121112.title: How's she do it?

15421111111211121.content:
Fox continued standing still, completely unable to move and completely horror-stricken at the fate of his friends. He saw Miss Weltzin lick her fingers and belch, then begin to approach him with that delicate walk women tend to adapt. She quickly chanted the now-familiar "Reduce" spell, waving her arms in the intricate motion of the spellcaster. He began to perspire madly as he stared straight ahead at her shins a second after she finished. "This is it," he thought, "I'm going to be eaten while paralyzed and we're going to lose to that gigantic army..."
Just then, Peppy's face came up from Fox's comlink. It announced, "Well, Fox, looks like we won't need Miss Weltzin's help anymore. That army on the monitor turned out to be a bunch of dust particles. Isn't that funny? You can come back to the Great Fox now. Peppy, over and out." The face disappeared, and with it, Fox's last hope of salvation.
Fox felt himself grasped in a large hand and lifted into the air. He passed the denim jeans, the cloth in the belt holders, the belly where his friends now reside, the somewhat-visible ribcage, the chest he was attracted to for a small amount of time, the scarf, and finally reached the large face of his defeater. That she had a reputation for kindness and benevolence seemed an insane notion at this moment, when she was opening her jaws, revealing that deathtrap that had claimed everyone and would now claim him.
Samantha glomped about half of Fox's body, leaving his abdomen down outside her lips. She licked his face and realized this was the tastiest member by far. She grasped him between her sharp teeth, pushed his butt into her mouth, then slurped up his legs and tail. She smiled, drool finding its way out of her lips and onto her chin. Samantha spent the better part of a minute tossing Fox around in her mouth, scratching his back with her teeth, and otherwise getting his flavor out of him and onto her taste buds to the maximum effect. About halfway through, the "Hold Person" spell wore off and Fox began to struggle, making it even nicer for her. She opened her jaws one more time and stuck out her tongue with Fox sitting on it.
He took one last look at the outside world, tried to get up and run, heedless of the fall that was sure to come, but tripped on the saliva and fell flat on his face. He looked up and held out his hand, screaming, "NOOOOO!" as the tongue re-entered the mouth and the teeth in front of him clamped together, sealing off all light. He felt himself flopped backward and began a feet-first descent into Samantha's stomach.
15421111111211121.title: Goodbye, Fox.

154211111112111211.content:
Samantha looked left, then right, then down. Her belly was a little bit extended from this rather large meal. She knew it would go back to its normal size in about a day or so, but it was still a little disturbing to think that it was made that way from living beings. Then again...they tasted so wonderful. She decided it was about time to clear this up with her secretary and make sure she didn't tattle. After all, if Samantha was in jail, she couldn't do any good for the universe. She felt a little kick in her stomach and thought that this must be what a child in her uterus is like. She burped again, licked her lips, patted her stomach, and walked toward the door.
The secretary was outside, still playing games, though not listening to music anymore. She saw the door open and Miss Weltzin walk out. Was it just her, or had Miss Weltzin gained a few pounds? She decided not to ask.
Samantha said, "Uh...I just ate those people who came in. You warned them about my PMS, right?"
The secretary grew wide-eyed behind her large wire-rimmed glasses. She nodded, speechless.
Samantha sighed, "Okay...I thought as much. Anyway, can you...not say anything about this?"
The secretary was ecstatic that Miss Weltzin would confide something like this in her, and she figured they could become close. Perhaps she would even become part of history. Miss Weltzin was going places, she could tell. "It'll be our little secret," she said, and winked.
Samantha smiled, burped again, and said, "Thanks. I knew I could count on you." She walked back into her office to finish her papers and digest her recent meal.
154211111112111211.title: All loose ends tied together.

154212.content: Alright. She'll eat someone she shouldn't be able to handle, and gain a gigantic gut (unless her metabolism's good enough to not even have to worry about same-size vore changing her figure). Who d'ya' want?
154212.title: Who's she eating?

choices: Other (*Make sure you put this in every chapter!*)
15422.content:
Lander is the lone survivor of his family - as far as he knows, and of his species for that matter. His father was a Fox, and his mother was a Cougar.

Lander has saphire-blue fur and emerald-green eyes, standing at almost 6' even. He has always had quite a bit of skill with blades, though it doesn't come up very often.

His parents were both murdered while on a vacation to a seemingly uninhabited planet soon after he was born. His father was set ablaze, while his mother was pinned to a tree by a spear through her chest.

He was found a week or so later by a family of Dragons, and later, was taken in by the Star Fox Team when they were doing a routine sweep over the system. After a while, he was sent off to the Academy, and returned not too long after that, with a high rank, even beating Fox's! He now spends his time tagging along with the Star Fox Team, not a member, but a close friend.
15422.title: Lander

choices: Other (*Make sure you put this in every chapter!*)
154222.content: A small shadow stood on the tallest skyscraper in Corneria. Few people noticed. He sighed a deep sigh, longing for excitement.(Not sexual, mind you, he had his *cough,cough* cut off. He was glad to have it removed) He hungered for action. He was born as prey, not predator, but he could hold his own. He only allowed those he liked to vore him. A ring helped him survive rare trips to the stomach. He was half weasel, half otter, yet very small. But he learned to fight well and to disarm and spare his opponent. He wore a red open vest with red baggy pants with chains.His hair was born red, which he adored. He always had a smile on his face, no matter what happened.=D He was so polite that he never swore and always respected his supers. His one weakness was his want for a mother, as he never knew his. Which he always yearned for the breast of a mother. His weapons were a red amazingly sharp katana, and in the other hand had a gold large claymore which he used with one hand efficiently well. Something caught his bright red eyes. A blue female fox(Krystal, he doesn't know it yet) was being harassed by a male lizard and a male badger. He grinned a short smile, which flashed his two sharp teeth. With his hard-earned ninja experience, he jumped off the building, blocking the sun for a short moment. Many people looked up and gasped. He then applied himself to the side of the building and began to run down the wall. He landed with a soft thud completely unharmed. People looked amazed and returned to their business. Time to get back to his. He walked to the alley where the criminals were. He appeared right behind them and said, " Please apologize and leave right now." They rolled their eyes and turned around. He saw the neck hairs on their back stand when he first spoke, but then they relaxed. " Go home, kid or you may get hurt," said the badger. "Yesssssssssssssss, little boy, run home," his the lizard. In the one second after he spoke, a flash of red and gold streaked the area at lightning-speed. The badger and lizard found themselves in their underwear and left screaming. He let out a small smirk and flashed a half smile and turned around. "Are you okay....,", that was as far as he got because his vision was blocked by blue fur. Krystal had hugged him and since he was small, his face was buried in her breasts. His hand began to twitch uncontrollably, eager to remove the piece of clothing that blockaded his path to a motherly feel. However, he resisted, though his hand began to sweat. Finally, she let go. It was almost like pure torture. " You should join our group, we need someone of your skill. I'm Krystal, and you?" He looked up and smiled and replied," I'm Pyrokense."
154222.title: A Red Flash

1542221.content: He paced back and forth thinking about the offer. If you stayed, you would always be near Krystal and go to new places. After a while, he made his final decision. "Alright, I'll join. It sounds like fun." "Great, that's good news," she said with a smile. Walking beside her, they traveled to the ship. He looked plainly for he had never seen a spaceship. "Let's introduce you to the crew," she said. The ship's interior was comfortable to his feet. (He took of his shoes like the respectful person he is.) In the training room, there was a brown fox, a blue bird(he could tell it was a falcon), and a frog and hare were watching. The hare was almost asleep. "Who's that, Krystal," the fox asked. "This is our newest and youngest member of Star Fox, Pyrokense," she said. "Pyro for short," Pyro said, extending a hand. " My name is Fox," he said, shaking his hand politely. "The name's Falco," the bird said, arms akimbo." That's Peppy and Slippy," He pointed to the hare and the frog. " Nice to meat you, sir," Pyro said bowing politely. "Wish he was here to greet you," Fox said. Pyro cocked his head to the side. "Who's he?" " You'll meet him later," Fox said. " So, what can you do, " yawned Falco. " Well, I am good at Close-Quarters Combat, can disarm at close and long range, extremely acrobatic, and very experienced in oriental weaponry," he counted on his fingers. " Really? Show me what you got, " Falco beckoned. Grinning a devil-may-care smile, he dug into his pocket and fished out his red gloves. "I'm ready to go," he said his eyes sparkling with a blazing glint. Falco pulled out his blaster and began to shoot. Pyro avoided with lightning-fast movements and kept moving until he was face to face with Falco. He pushed the gun up and grabbed his arm and flipped him on his back within 0.05 seconds. Everyone was dumbstruck at the display of skill. "Impressive." Pyro turned and saw............
1542221.title: Join the group

15422211.content:
The green dragon we all know and love, Fatal T. Oikonny. The dragon had blond hair, long majestic horns, an air of importance around him, and a tall stature. But most of all was the weapons he carried on him. Pyro was amazed that he was not hindered by all this weaponry. "Bravo, young lad,"the dragon said, clapping his hands with gleaming sharp claws. "Thank you for your applause, but...who are you," he said bowing with respect. "Oh, pardon my manners. I am Fatal T. Oikonny, Grand Major," he said,waving his tail with the trademark spade at the end. "Nice to meet you,sir." "So I hear you want to join Star Fox, kid."
Pyrokense had another side to balance out his respectful side, which usually took place when he battled.It was awake at this moment. "Heck Yeah,"Pyro's teeth became sharp and scars appeared on the side of his face. His eyes had a reckless glint in them again. This side was known as Tejas. "Well, in order to grant access, you gotta show some skill and promise." Tejas gripped his claymore and threw aside the case. "Alright! FULL POWER! HERE WE GO!" The room was charged with burning energy as Tejas charged forward toward FT.

info.description:
Alright, here we go. As the title says, this is for StarFox vore(eating one another). There's not enough of this around, and all of the VG vore stories here focus on PS2 games.
Some rules:

A) Soft vore please! Hard vore is allowed, though. ORAL VORE only. No cock/anal/unbirthing/etc
B) Digestion is allowed
C) Any kind of yiff is allowed (M/F, M/M, F/F, etc)
D) Original characters are now allowed
E) Try to prevent from posting one-liners unless it's for a choice chapter. (Ex: Fox walked up and ate Krystal, the end!)
F) In character selection chapters, please leave an option for more characters. There are a lot in the universe than just StarFox, StarWolf, and the StarFox's team's friends.
G) GTS and shrinking is allowed, but try to keep the females on the growth side. Either side can shrink/grow, though.
H) As of this point, no humans. Any chapters with humans will be deleted. Sorry, but this IS a furry game and a furry story.
I) Female predators are discouraged, but I won't stop you

Alright, let's get going! Eat!
